comment: I got a chance to sample this at a bar recently and I found it a very pleasant dram.  The nose features a nice mix of honey, vanilla and grain notes.  These flavors are repeated on the palate but a hint of sherry is lurking beneath the surface to keep things interesting.  On the negative side, the mouth feel is a bit thin (you could call it "light" if you're being charitable) and the finish is quite short - don't even think of adding water to this whisky.  Overall, The Glenrothes Vintage Reserve is not what I would call an overtly complex or bold scotch, but sometimes you're in the mood for something mellow and this fits the bill quite nicely.
Not a speyside fan myself, this whisky surprised me. It is a typical speyside, sweet, rich, honeyed, but it blends together so well.
Flash of vanilla at the finsh

This is a very light whiskey.  I disagree with the thought that it lacks complexity.  There are several different layers of flavors. Honey and vanilla are the first wave followed by the floral notes.  Great bottle for the Spring.
This was nice. Much deeper than than the Bourbon Cask Reserve.

Valentines Gift from my lovely wife! The nose is a huge floral bouquet. It's quite light and single note, but pleasant and not overly sweet. It's simple but enjoyable. I think it'll make for a nice relaxing dram!
Very sweet on the nose. Light on the palate. Got a very strong cigar-like tobacco on the back end.
It was whatever. The nose was nice...ish...  . I wasn’t disappointed or impressed.
Flavor needs to sit on the tongue to come out
Rich caramel and vanilla hit the nose right away. A mild maple and fruity middle tones find their way at the end and on the tongue. This is a solid single malt for the price. (FWF share #3)
Awesome neat. Favorite bang for buck so far.

The first thing you experience in this whiskey is a nose with hints of brown sugar and vanilla. Inside your mouth you're welcomed with more bourbon than sherry, with oak really taking dominance.  The body is regretfully light, almost to the point of being ridiculous, and the finish is terribly short. This isn't a bad whiskey. Simply an uninspiring one.
Buttery pear. Very smooth. I can smell thin without any burn. Didn't need ice
Nice spicy flavor, complex for a 12 year
bright, nice balanced caramel underneath, subtle peaty flavor
good. sweet with slight peaty flavor. Nothing mind blowing but smooth

Maybe it was a bad batch (50 ml) but this tasted like straight ass. The nose was musty and the same note followed thru to the palate. 

I’m an islay guy too so I’m ready to try “heavy stuff” but this taste like straight booty.
Delish, smooth whiskey with middle of the road signals.

tastes of honey and butterscotch but never cloying, this is the scotch that will turn a bourbon lover into a scotch believer. And how fucking majestic does that bottle look on your bar? Come to me, my sweet.
The flavors are maybe a touch disjointed but overall quite nice. Darker fruit with caramel, spice, and a little floral. Would pay $40 again but not much more.

Wet wood, leathery nose that takes a bit getting used to. Lots of warm, vanilla-honey flavors on the palate, with a really cool drying, almost salty finish. Nothing life-changing here, but a really cool, interesting option for a collection.

Really interesting dram. The initial scent I find is fresh hay. Cereal, a bit of citrus zest, cinnamon and clove are also there. Full mouth feel and very smooth but then something really interesting happens after the slight heat at the end, all of a sudden is gone with such a subtle finish. It is like star fruit if you have ever had it. You eat it and it is crisp and juicy and once you swallow, almost nothing. 🥃

Overwhelming honey on the nose, with hints of vanilla cream throughout. This follows through on the taste, with honey, vanilla, and candies. Reminds me of Macallan, except it's lighter and more floral
Slightly sweeter than the others tonight, but I don’t think I want anymore

Very interesting and unusual.
Light golden colour with some brown flake. 
Cloves and dark honey are primary to the nose. Then come tones of fresh green apples (as it is with Balblair, also a vintage), some citruses, vanilla and caramel.
The taste is totally smooth, even watery, no spiritous notes at all. Pleasant, mouthfeeling but not very well balanced.
Again - much honey, apples, a bit of spices.
Finish is real good. It can be truly identified with bourbon (Buffalo Trace, perhaps) if we'd judge it only by its aftertaste. It’s long, sweet, full of nuts and wild berries.
Glenrothes is ultimately satisfying, intriguing (mostly due to its incredible aroma) but lacks a bit of a balance. A perfect whiskey to get acknowledged with the distillery and not a bad partner for a lonely night or cigar.
Just overall sort of weak. Not impressed. Not following the flavor profile suggestions. Might need to improve my floral palette.
Smaakt veel hetzelfde als de 10y. Ietsje meer pit.

Nose: sweet custard, hints of citrus, vanilla and spice
Taste: lightly spiced vanilla custard, faint notes of grass and an orange/lemon flavor
Finish: short with sweet Sherry flavors changing to a hint of maple bourbon

My scoring system often gets me high points for some whiskies, and even with that system this dram couldn't make it to 4.0. Don't get me wrong, it is not a bad dram at all, but what it has in complexity on the nose just couldn't deliver into the palate and the finish is way to short and a little boring.

Bottled at 40%abv, golden color.

On the nose is quite a jewel. Lots of aroma notes:Hazelnut, Cocoa Milk powder, Wedding cake, Raisins, Nice aroma not savage nor dim, After a while pear or green apples appear, After a longer while lemonade appears. Prunes also.

On the palate is easy, with Almonds, Nutty and Oaky, Cinnamon and Plain old wood. Finish is very short with cinnamon hints. 

Overall i give this dram a 79 over 100, and that is because the nose is so great.

Good, smooth.  But the Sherry and Bourbon cask reserves are a bit tastier.



My Rating Glossary:  

Two Stars:           "I'd rather be drinking lite beer."
Two 1/2 Stars:    "Posh rubbish."
Three Stars:        "I love whisk(e)y.  This is average love."
Three 1/2 Stars: "May buy again."
Four Stars:          "I've got to get you into my life."
Four 1/2 Stars:   "Better than drugs."
Five Stars:           "Life is good.  Whisky makes it better."
